nodes.name: Slack: Post Answers from Intake Form in #new_clients channel

values.content:
=Instruction:
Create a comprehensive Marketing Research Report for the brand using the structured inputs below. The report should be professional, organized, and easy to read. Use clear section headers, subheaders, bullet points, and short paragraphs where appropriate. The tone should be insightful, strategic, and actionable ‚Äî written as if presenting to a marketing team or stakeholders.
Report Structure
1. Brand & Product Overview
Website: {{ $('Customer Info').item.json.Website }}
Business Description (1‚Äì2 sentences): {{ $('Customer Info').item.json['In 1-2 sentences, please describe your business in your own words'] }}
Brand Origin: {{ $('Customer Info').item.json['Can you go over the brand‚Äôs origin story?'] }}
Unique Differentiator: {{ $('Customer Info').item.json['What makes your brand special/unique?'] }}
Product Evolution: {{ $('Product info').item.json['Can you talk about how your product offering has evolved?'] }}
Best-Selling Products: {{ $('Product info').item.json['What are your best selling products?'] }}
Negative Feedback / Criticism: {{ $('Product info').item.json['What negative feedback do you receive the most about your product?'] }}
Sales Channels Beyond Shopify: {{ $('Product info').item.json['What other channels is your product sold on? (Amazon, Wholesale, Retail)'] }}
Main Competitors: {{ $('Marketing & Customers').item.json['Who are your main competitors, both product and in your vertical?'] }}
Primary Product Focus for Ads: {{ $('Product info').item.json['Which product should we focus on for our first ads that we make?'] }}
Product URL / Description: {{ $('Product info').item.json['Please share the product URL'] }}
Target Audience (brand‚Äôs own view): {{ $('Marketing & Customers').item.json['Who do you think your audience is?'] }}
Brand Guidelines / No-No‚Äôs:{{ $('Marketing & Customers').item.json['Any No-No\'s with the brand that we should be aware of?'] }}
2. Core Customer Insights
Features ‚Äì What the product offers
Benefits ‚Äì Why these features matter to customers
Pain Points ‚Äì Core frustrations or problems the product solves
Objections ‚Äì Common reasons customers hesitate to purchase
Failed Solutions ‚Äì Other methods/products customers tried before
Emotions ‚Äì Emotional triggers tied to the purchase decision
Primary Motivations ‚Äì e.g., Esteem, Empowerment, Belonging, Security
3. Persona-Based Marketing
(If enough data is available ‚Äî otherwise optional)
Demographics: Age, gender, income, education, etc.
Psychographics: Values, lifestyles, habits, attitudes
Awareness Levels: Unaware ‚Üí Problem Aware ‚Üí Solution Aware ‚Üí Product Aware ‚Üí Fully Aware
4. Customer Voice & Social Proof
Static Headlines from Customer Reviews: Short, punchy lines that highlight key problems/solutions
First-Person Testimonials: Lightly edited for clarity, written in customers‚Äô own words
5. Market Comparisons
Failed Solutions List: 5 most common alternatives that disappointed customers
Competitive Positioning: How this brand can frame itself advantageously in ‚ÄúUs vs. Them‚Äù campaigns
6. Trigger Events
Purchase Triggers: Life events, emotional moments, or situational cues that make customers ready to buy
7. Positioning Strategy
Perception in Customer‚Äôs Mind: Where the product should sit relative to competitors
Messaging Opportunities: Key storylines or brand narratives that resonate
8. Awareness Stages Mapping
Provide examples of how the customer moves through awareness stages for this product:
Unaware ‚Üí Problem Aware ‚Üí Solution Aware ‚Üí Product Aware ‚Üí Aware (Purchase Ready)
9. Marketing Angles & Hooks
Angles to Test: Money-saving, premium/luxury, artisanal/local, gifting, practical benefits, emotional storytelling, etc.
Concepts: Campaign ideas and narratives
Hooks: Short, scroll-stopping phrases/headlines to test in ads
Formatting Notes
Use Markdown formatting (### headers, bold text, bullet points).
Keep each section concise but insightful.
Ensure the report reads like a strategic deliverable ‚Äî not just raw notes.

nodes.name: Slack: Notify Revised Research brief is in Google Drive

parameters.content:
# Client Onboarding & Research Brief Automation

## What this workflow does
This workflow automates the complete client onboarding process for marketing agencies, triggered when a new client submits an intake form via Typeform.

## Key Features
- Automatically creates organized Google Drive folder structure with 6 main folders and multiple subfolders for client assets
- Posts comprehensive intake responses to Slack for team visibility  
- Uses AI (OpenAI) to generate a detailed marketing research brief based on client inputs
- Implements approval workflow with revision capability if changes are needed
- Creates and updates Google Docs with the finalized research brief
- Sends welcome email to new clients

## Setup Requirements
1. **Typeform account** with an intake form
2. **Slack workspace** with appropriate channels
3. **Google account** with Drive, Docs, and Gmail access
4. **OpenAI API key** for AI content generation

## How to set up
1. Configure all values in the "‚öôÔ∏è Configuration" node
2. Connect your accounts (Typeform, Slack, Google, OpenAI)
3. Set your Typeform webhook with your intake form ID
4. Configure Slack channel IDs for notifications and approvals
5. Specify the parent Google Drive folder for client folders
6. Customize the welcome email template in the Gmail node
7. Test with a sample form submission

## Benefits
- Saves 2-3 hours of manual setup per new client
- Ensures consistent folder structure and documentation
- Enables team collaboration through Slack notifications
- Maintains quality control with built-in approval process

## Step 1: Form Submission
Configure your Typeform ID in the Configuration node, then this trigger will activate when a client submits your intake form.

## Step 2: Create Folder Structure
Creates main client folder and all necessary subfolders in Google Drive

## Subfolder Creation
Creates organized folder structure for all client assets

## Step 3: Notify Team
Sends detailed intake form responses to Slack for team visibility

## Step 4: Welcome Email
Sends automated welcome email to the new client

## Step 5: AI Research Brief
Generates comprehensive marketing research document using OpenAI based on intake form responses

## Step 6: Approval Workflow
Sends research brief for team review with approval/revision process

## Step 7: Create Document
If approved, creates Google Doc with the research brief

## Revision Process
If not approved, collect feedback and generate revised version
